events.name: Puppet Camp Singapore
events.description: Come join us for our first Puppet Camp in Singapore this November 19th.  There are 10 Free Tickets Remaining.  Use Code: RobFinn100 Register Here! Agenda: 9:00 - 9:30: Check in / Registration9:30 - 10:30: Puppet Keynote - Nigel Kersten10:30 - 11:00: Break11:00 - 11:45: How Atlassian's Build Engineering Team Has Scaled to 150k Builds Per Month & Beyond - Peter Leschev, Atlassian11:45 - 1:00: Lunch1:00 - 2:00: Puppet Demo - Brett Gray, Puppet Labs2:00 - 2:45: Puppet with Oracle Databases - Ang Wei Shan, ArcusOne Pte Ltd2:45 - 3:15: Break3:15 - 4:00: Using Puppet Enterprise in a Traditional Enterprise - Walter Heck, OlinData Asia Pte Ltd4:00 - 5:30: Reception

events.name: The Cloud and .NET Moment - HTML5, WebApp, JavaScript, ES6, IoT, Visual Studio
events.description: This event is FREE! The next .NET Developers and Azure community meetup will be on Thursday, November 19th, 2015. This is a special edition of .NET developers and Azure community meetup. Let's have a Cloud and .NET moment! We have a high caliber speakers (thanks to Microsoft), coming down to Singapore, for you all. Do join us for this special Cloud and .NET Moment! Seriously, you might not get this moment again next time. Let's seat, relax and listen to our speakers talking on HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, Microsoft Edge browser, Apache Cordova, Cross-Platform Development and Visual Studio 2015 SPEAKER ONE Christian Heilmann: More than 20 years as Web expert, HTML5 and JavaScript expert, spoken at 129 events in 26 countries, a Developer Evangelist - all things for open web, HTML5, writing books, articles, blogs, podcast, Channel 9 (MSDN), YouTube, you name it!   Chris is a Senior Program Manager at Microsoft, working on Microsoft Edge. You want to know what is Microsoft Edge all about, first hand from the person, than you need to join this moment! Ask him! SPEAKER TWO Ryan J. Salva: JS Developer, Apache Cordova Advocate, Visual Studio Program Manager, CrossFitter, SciFi Connoisseur and Whiskey Enthusiast.  Ryan is a Principal Program Manager at Microsoft, working in the Visual Studio Client Tools team where he looks after HTML, CSS and JavaScript development. He comes from a 15 year career in web standards development & advocacy as an entrepreneur, developer and graphic designer. Today, he focuses primarily on mobile app development using web technologies and Apache Cordova. Seriously, if you want to know what is cross-platform or hybrid app, than he is one of the person you should see. Ask him! SPEAKER THREE Matthew Podwysocki: Matthew is a Principal SDE and open sourcerer at Microsoft with a focus on the Internet of Things, Reactive Programming At All Scales and teaching the next generation how to code.  He currently works on the Reactive Extensions for all languages including JavaScript. He is passionate about open source, having helped the Node.js effort on Windows, to open sourcing many libraries at Microsoft. GOODIES Win a unit of this (from one of the community member), if you can answer the not so easy question on web ecosystem related from speakers;  Also, from Microsoft sponsoring FREE T-Shirt for those who come to the event. Don't forget to RSVP first if you want the T-Shirt (only member in the RSVP List entitled to get the T-Shirt). Thank you Microsoft for the T-Shirt.  See you at the venue! Also there will be some light refreshment as well (food)!
events.location: NTUC Auditorium, Level 7 NTUC Centre, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Clojure Meetup #6; Tall tales from the ClojureScript Middle Earth wars!
events.description: For the 6th Clojure Meetup in Singapore, we have our first overseas speaker, Isaac Johnston. For those who don't know Clojure has a sibling for the front end, ClojureScript. Using the same criteria for the design of Clojure, ClojureScript is a self contained way of using the functional programming constructs you are familiar with in Clojure in the front end presentation layers. It compiles to pure Javascript with similar benefits that Clojure gains from running on the JVM.  The theme for this Meetup is ClojureScipt and we are very lucky to have Isaac Johnston giving our first talk. Isaacs's talk is titled: Half a Year using Clojurescript and React in MiddleEarth Isaac is an experienced Javascript developer continually exploring different ways to write JavaScript. He works tirelessly defending his home of middle earth's and other far off land's communications at SMX, a global cloud security and carrier-grade email provider. Passionate about functional programming, he is currently prototyping SMX's next generation front-end stack in ClojureScript and React. He is coming to us from JConf.Asia where he has given a talk "Simplicity Through Functions" earlier today. Ours second speaker is Melvin Zhang whose demo is titled: Building a reactive web frontend with Hoplon  Melvin is an avid programmer who enjoys designing and implementing novelalgorithms.  As the lead architect of Cosmiqo, Melvin is in charge of developing its sensor data aggregation and analytics platform. In his sparetime, Melvin works on the AI for Magarena, an open source card game project. He also gave the first talk in this meetup. We will be taking  break in December but the January meetup will be announced before the end of the month.

events.name: Meteor November Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. We have food and drinks kindly provided by our venue sponsor, Netsuite ;-) For any visiting developers who are coming to JSConf on this day please join our meetup to socialize with the Meteor Singapore community! ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - 3-Way Data Binding Framework for Meteor - 20 min - Jeremy Chen Experiences of a newbie software engineer writing a "reasonably fully featured" three-way data binding framework. #2 - EJSON support for Moment.js in Meteor - 5 min - Hao Yang Ang A package developed by one of the Meteor Singapore community #3 - Server Side Rendering - What, Why and How - 10 min - Ryan Swart A quick overview of SSR and how to implement it with React in Meteor. #4 - IoThingies - 15 min We will talk about our winning entry in the recent Meteor Global Hackathon. Details: IoThingies on Devpost #5 - Open Discussion on Data Processing preferences #6 - Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: </a>https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: <a href="https://meteorsg.slack.com/">https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: <a href="http://singapore.meteor.com/"></a>http://singapore.meteor.com/ #7 - Socializing / Networking  ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Please note this is a new location for us. Thanks to Duncan for helping to organize. We should have food/beverages provided by the venue ;-) Organizers: Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Duncan Foster Venue sponsor: Netsuite
events.location: Netsuite, 9 Battery Road, #08-01, Straits Trading Building, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Strangeweather Movement Group with Andy Yang: Spooky Action (at a Distance) II
Thursday 19 November
Performance starts at 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Lobby
FREE


For ArtScience Late, Strangeweather Movement Group revisits a 2013 performance work, Spooky Action (at a Distance), in collaboration with visual artist and musician Andy Yang. In Spooky, Strangeweather considers the theory of quantum entanglement, puts it on the backburner, and creates an off-kilter dance performance of impolite improvisation scores and congruent choreography. Yang intercepts the performance with a resounding set installation and what happens next is anyone’s guess. This rendition of Spooky is performed by Bernice Lee, Faye Lim and Andy Yang. Excerpts of the original performance were featured in filmmaker Karol Jalochowski’s documentary, Reality Lost, which was commissioned by NUS Centre for Quantum
